body_html:
@girving I am having problems with my laptop after upgrading ubuntu to
16.04. I can't get internet and the display manager working. Should I
close this pull request or leave it for someone else to take it over? I am
not sure when i can get back to this.

On Wed, Aug 17, 2016, 12:03 AM Alan Wu alan.c.wu@gmail.com wrote:

Looks like no more hiding shameful mistakes like math.ops.. :P
But I see your point.

Still trying to figure out how to use and test the gradient operations.
If someone has urgent need for this, feel free to pick it up. Otherwise
I'll keep trying tomorrow night.

On Mon, Aug 15, 2016 at 10:30 AM, Geoffrey Irving <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

By the way: add new commits rather than overwriting old commits, since it
makes it easier to incrementally review.

—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#3807 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADzDDKiVQvc3rc054t78MVSpfvvWxPxJks5qgKItgaJpZM4Jj8mC
.

16.04.  I can't get internet and the display manager working.  Should I
close this pull request or leave it for someone else to take it over?  I am

body:
@girving I am having problems with my laptop after upgrading ubuntu to
16.04.  I can't get internet and the display manager working.  Should I
close this pull request or leave it for someone else to take it over?  I am
not sure when i can get back to this.

On Wed, Aug 17, 2016, 12:03 AM Alan Wu alan.c.wu@gmail.com wrote:

> Looks like no more hiding shameful mistakes like math.ops..  :P
> But I see your point.
> 
> Still trying to figure out how to use and test the gradient operations.
> If someone has urgent need for this, feel free to pick it up.  Otherwise
> I'll keep trying tomorrow night.

> notifications@github.com> wrote:
